title: I will keep reporting until someone helps me for real!
body:
Type: Bug EVERY TIME, again, EVERY SINGLE TIME... I use GitHub Copilot, doesn't matter the model, after a while it gets stuck, either with the error that I am reporting (413), 412 or "Sorry, your request failed. Please try again. Request id: 89f70909-b7db-40b9-94f6-3f92e50e6e32 Reason: Please check your firewall rules and network connection then try again. Error Code: net::ERR_HTTP2_PROTOCOL_ERROR.". And not only that, it gets my entire computer to lag, freeze and slowing it down until I close the VS code entierly and start a new session/re open it. This is VERY annoying, not only because it makes me waste my time closing and openning it again but also because I have to restart my session whitout a chance to store/take note of what was done, which means all the contex is gone and a lot of wasted time to get the AI aware of context and back on track. As a paying customer, pricipally to microsoft, this is the worse experience ever with an AI "copilot". title: Bump koa and @vscode/test-web

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: JavaScript support issues

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [koa](https://github.com/koajs/koa) to 3.0.1 and updates ancestor dependency [@vscode/test-web](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-test-web). These dependencies need to be updated together. Updates `koa` from 2.16.1 to 3.0.1
Release notes

Sourced from koa's releases.

v3.0.1

What's Changed

  • fix(security): only allow same origin referer on response back https://github.com/koajs/koa/commit/422c551c63d00f24e2bbbdf492f262a5935bb1f0
  • chore: adds initial doc text refresh; migration guide [CHORE-1870] by @​yowainwright in koajs/koa#1877
  • build(deps-dev): bump formidable from 3.5.2 to 3.5.4 by @​dependabot[bot] in koajs/koa#1878
  • chore: removes done callbacks in tests [CHORE-1870] by @​yowainwright in koajs/koa#1875
  • build(deps-dev): bump supertest from 7.1.0 to 7.1.1 by @​dependabot[bot] in koajs/koa#1879
  • build(deps): bump debug from 4.4.0 to 4.4.1 by @​dependabot[bot] in koajs/koa#1880
  • feat: replace debug module with pure node:util::debuglog by @​3imed-jaberi in koajs/koa#1885
  • feat: replace cache-content-type with mime-types directly by @​3imed-jaberi in koajs/koa#1886
  • build(deps): bump statuses from 2.0.1 to 2.0.2 by @​dependabot[bot] in koajs/koa#1888
  • build(deps-dev): bump supertest from 7.1.1 to 7.1.4 by @​dependabot[bot] in koajs/koa#1895
  • build(deps-dev): bump form-data from 4.0.3 to 4.0.4 by @​dependabot[bot] in koajs/koa#1894

Full Changelog: https://github.com/koajs/koa/compare/v3.0.0...v3.0.1

v3.0.0

This is a major release.

Breaking

  • Minimum node v18
  • Removes .redirect('back'), adds .back(fallback_url) @​fl0w koajs/koa#1115
  • For .redirect(), don't render redirect values in anchor ref https://github.com/koajs/koa/commit/ff25eb4a7f2392df46481fe86355161067687312
  • req.origin should display the origin header if it exists, not the current hostname koajs/koa#1008. origin now aligns with the Origin header as used in CORS.
  • .body=<json> should not overwrite type if type already json koajs/koa#1120
  • Remove special ENOENT support koajs/koa#1861 - this is a big change and will require any file servers to adapt to this change for handling 404s / files not found
  • Removes generator deprecation messages. Generators are no longer supported. Koa no longer asserts if generators are used. Set content-length: 0 if body is explicitly set to null @​ognjenjevremovic #1528 Remove obsolete createAsyncCtxStorageMiddleware koajs/koa#1817
  • ctx.throw now requires a format of ctx.throw(status, error, properties). See: https://www.npmjs.com/package/http-errors

New

  • Support custom streams @​KristapsR koajs/koa#1825
  • Support WHATWG response bodies koajs/koa#1830 @​kravorkid
  • Use asyncLocalStorage to get current context from app, e.g.: const ctx = app.currentContext.

Fixes

  • Handle responses when socket is no longer writable @​titanism @​azlond koajs/koa#1593
  • fix: Do not response Content-Length if Transfer-Encoding is defined #1562 @​charlyzeng
  • fix: Set body to 'null' if ctx.type = 'json' and ctx.body = null #1059 @​likegun
  • fix: can not get currentContext in error handler (#1758) (Gxkl <gxkl203@gmail.com>)
  • Fix exports.defaults in package.json koajs/koa#1630
  • Fix leaky handles in tests koajs/koa#1838
  • Fix body null checks koajs/koa#1814
  • Fix reformatting redirect URLs koajs/koa#1805 koajs/koa#1804
  • Fix passing ctx in error handler koajs/koa#1758

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from koa's changelog.

[!IMPORTANT] Moving forwards we are using the GitHub releases page at https://github.com/koajs/koa/releases in combination with np for publishing releases and their changelogs.

3.0.0-alpha.3 / 2025-02-11

fixes

  • Avoid redos on host and protocol getter

3.0.0-alpha.2 / 2024-11-04

breaking changes

  • Update http-errors to v2.0.0 #1486
    • ctx.throw now requires a format of ctx.throw(status, error, properties). See: https://www.npmjs.com/package/http-errors
  • Remove res.redirect('back'), add back() method to ctx #1115
  • Replace node querystring with URLSearchParams #1828
  • Remove obsolete createAsyncCtxStorageMiddleware #1817

features

  • Add support for web WHATWG #1830

updates

  • Update cookies to ~0.9.1 #1846
  • Update statuses to ^2.0.1
  • Update supertest to ^7.0.0 #1841

fixes

  • Fix exports.defaults in package.json #1630
  • Fix leaky handles in tests #1838
  • Fix body null checks #1814
  • Fix reformatting redirect URLs #1805 #1804
  • Fix passing ctx in error handler #1758

migrations

  • Migrate from jest to the native node test runner #1845

3.0.0-alpha.1 / 2023-04-12

fixes

  • [e98b8d1] - fix: can not get currentContext in error handler (#1758) (Gxkl <gxkl203@gmail.com>)

3.0.0-alpha.0 / 2023-01-02

Breaking Changes

... (truncated)

title: `run_tests` tool hangs indefinitely when test files have compilation errors
body:
Type: Bug # `run_tests` tool hangs indefinitely when test files have compilation errors ## Environment - VS Code Copilot - macOS - .NET 9.0 project ## Description The `run_tests` tool hangs indefinitely when provided with test files that contain compilation errors, requiring manual cancellation and making development workflow inefficient. ## Expected Behavior When `run_tests` is called with files that have compilation errors, it should: 1. Attempt to build the test project first 2. Return compilation errors immediately if build fails 3. Fail gracefully with clear error messages 4. Not hang indefinitely ## Actual Behavior The tool hangs without any output when given test files with compilation errors, requiring user intervention to cancel the operation. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Create a test file with missing using statements or namespace errors 2. Call `run_tests` tool with parameter: `files=["/path/to/problematic/test/file.cs"]` 3. Tool hangs indefinitely with no output or error message ## Example Code ```typescript // Tool call that causes the hang: run_tests({ files: ["/Users/example/repo/tests/TestWithCompilationErrors.cs"] }) ``` ## Root Cause Analysis The run_tests tool likely doesn't handle compilation failures properly and gets stuck waiting for test results that will never be produced due to build failures. ## Suggested Fix Add pre-flight compilation check before attempting to run tests Implement proper error handling for build failures Add reasonable timeout to prevent infinite hangs Return meaningful error messages for compilation issues ## Impact This significantly slows down development workflow when iterating on test files, as developers must manually cancel hung operations and debug compilation issues separately. title: Bug Report: No Extensions, No Account Settings, and No Agent Chat in Browser-Based Code Server
body: When running the web version of VS Code via code-server (on localhost:9888), the browser does not show any extensions, does not allow account sign-in, and does not provide access to any chat agents (e.g., Copilot/Chat). This severely limits usability. i am using windows 11 with all the requierments given by vscode docs Launch Command: **npm run watch npm run watch-web ./scripts/code-server.bat** and URL Accessed: _http://localhost:9888_ 🔍 Observed Behavior Extensions tab shows only: **LOCALHOST:9888 - INSTALLED (0) BROWSER - INSTALLED (0)** 🧪 Steps to Reproduce Clone the VS Code source repo. **npm install npm run watch npm run watch-web ./scripts/code-server.bat** Open http://localhost:9888 in a browser. Check Extensions tab, Account icon, and Side Bar. Attaching Screenshot of the Extensions Panel showing no entries.

Type: Bug EVERY TIME, again, EVERY SINGLE TIME... I use GitHub Copilot, doesn't matter the model, after a while it gets stuck, either with the error that I am reporting (413), 412 or "Sorry, your request failed. Please try again. Request id: 89f70909-b7db-40b9-94f6-3f92e50e6e32 Reason: Please check your firewall rules and network connection then try again. Error Code: net::ERR_HTTP2_PROTOCOL_ERROR.". And not only that, it gets my entire computer to lag, freeze and slowing it down until I close the VS code entierly and start a new session/re open it. title: Link tooltip removes duplicated backslashes
body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes, I confirm that I can still reproduce the problem. - VS Code Version: 1.102.3 - OS Version: macOS Sequoia 15.5 Steps to Reproduce: ``` 123456789 123456789 ``` 1. Create a text file with the content above. 2. Create an extension with the content below. 3. Debug the extension. 4. Open the text file from step 1. 5. Hover and see that the tooltip shows only one backslash instead of two... 🤔 6. I can also reproduce this problem in Monaco. See [here](https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/playground.html?source=v0.52.2#XQAAAALoAgAAAAAAAABBqQkHQ5NjdMjwa-jY7SIQ9S7DNlzs5W-mwj0fe1ZCDRFc9ws9XQE0SJE1jc2VKxhaLFIw9vEWSxW3yscw2lVGK-fb61V4RRRIXZLwOtway9xd419kSKApypZi_K4Xs2zBY0-4jqqpjTibCKKzn3KXkBDVkGllkxk3RB1wWkFLb4vGOdzkcn-rG3pIXLhZo9wPlQ1-SCUGax6COYOuL2EIh7mMLs1u2pwXf3bSPZHw4Gc3ra2jDBLcFM4Rk82nV9Jm3WPBQRHxpmVSvFf_D_35txZVuT7B9HONOxO5DXYgaRLAzovTsY4EgubVH0GAJkPTE2yVCQWOGiUpWKygwMykqzI8G6nPdQTv6UT_HkOzcWRd_gO0jFj20YKduNYrFZVct3C6lumXJAU7bP0XoPmYFz1YURkz3mS-mNLvR8awNYAZ79fkqUbdHixp5UGPPcCqF8T4JdN1Im_-9JX_8bhGzw). ```TypeScript import * as vscode from 'vscode'; export function activate(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) { context.subscriptions.push(vscode.languages.registerDocumentLinkProvider("plaintext", { provideDocumentLinks: () => { return [ { target: vscode.Uri.parse("file:///tmp/hello.txt"), tooltip: "\\\\a\\\\b\\\\c", range: new vscode.Range(1, 0, 1, 5), } ]; } })); } ```

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 
- OS Version: 

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  navigate to this page: https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/python/python-tutorial
2. scroll down to the (1) Install packages section. The script below that heading is for installing numpy
Expected:  running `py -m pip install numpy` installs the numpy package
Actual: the following exception is thrown because py is not installed when you install python through the microsoft store

```powershell
(.venv) PS C:\git\hello> py -m pip install numpy
py : The term 'py' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program. Check the spelling of the name, or 
if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
At line:1 char:1
+ py -m pip install numpy
+ ~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (py:String) [], CommandNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException
```

Recommendation: update the documentation to have `python -m pip install numpy` instead or provided `py` when  installing from the microsoft store.

title: Enhance AI assistant user engagement for exploratory interactions in VS Code
body:
## Problem

Users engaging with the AI assistant in VS Code often find themselves in an exploratory phase where they want to understand the assistant's capabilities but haven't specified particular programming tasks. The existing welcome experience provided limited guidance for users seeking to discover what the AI assistant could help with, leading to a suboptimal onboarding experience.

## Solution

This PR implements comprehensive enhancements to improve user engagement with the AI assistant, specifically targeting users in the discovery phase:

### Key Changes

**1. Enhanced Welcome Experience**
- Updated welcome message to be more informative about programming assistance capabilities
- Added contextual tips for users unsure where to start
- Improved visual hierarchy and information architecture

**2. Capability Discovery Service**
Created a new `ChatCapabilityDiscoveryService` that provides:
- Structured information about AI assistant capabilities (Code Generation, Debugging, Learning, etc.)
- Context-aware examples based on workspace state
- Interactive capability overview for exploratory users

**3. Improved Suggested Prompts**
- **Empty Workspace**: Focus on learning-oriented prompts and capability discovery
- **Project Workspace**: Emphasize project-specific assistance and code analysis
- Added comprehensive capability overview prompt for users who want to explore what the assistant can do

**4. Progressive Disclosure**
- Limited number of initial suggestions to avoid overwhelming users
- Provided clear pathways from exploration to specific assistance
- Added helpful tips and best practices for effective interaction

### Technical Implementation

- **Service Registration**: Integrated `ChatCapabilityDiscoveryService` into VS Code's dependency injection system
- **Enhanced Chat Widget**: Updated `chatWidget.ts` to use the new capability discovery service
- **Comprehensive Testing**: Added test suite covering capability discovery and user engagement scenarios
- **TypeScript Compliance**: All changes follow VS Code coding guidelines and architectural patterns

### Example Capabilities Covered

The enhanced interface now helps users discover assistance with:
- **Code Generation**: Writing functions, classes, and complete programs
- **Code Explanation**: Understanding complex logic and adding documentation  
- **Debugging**: Identifying bugs and suggesting fixes
- **Learning**: Teaching programming concepts and best practices
- **Code Review**: Reviewing code for improvements and performance
- **Testing**: Writing unit tests and testing strategies

### User Experience Impact

Users now receive:
- Clear understanding of what the AI assistant can help with
- Contextual guidance based on their current workspace
- Interactive examples that demonstrate specific capabilities
- Reduced cognitive load through focused, relevant suggestions
- Better pathways from exploration to productive assistance

![Enhanced User Engagement Interface](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e921c2b5-b92e-4db4-9c3b-26587313fe69)

This enhancement directly addresses the scenario where users are exploring AI assistant capabilities without having specific tasks in mind, providing a more engaging and discoverable experience that helps users understand the full potential of their AI programming assistant.

        agent=AgentType.ZERO_SHOT_REACT_DESCRIPTION,
        verbose=False,  # For debugging, set to False if not needed
        agent_kwargs={"prompt": prompt},
    )

    return agent

if __name__ == "__main__":

from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.chrome.options import Options
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By

import pdfkit
import re

def get_all_links(url):
    options = Options()
    options.add_argument("--headless")
    driver = webdriver.Chrome(options=options)
    driver.get(url)
    soup = BeautifulSoup(driver.page_source, "html.parser")
    driver.quit()
    links = set()
    for a in soup.find_all("a", href=True):
        href = a["href"]
        if href.startswith("http"):
            links.add(href)
        elif href.startswith("/"):
            links.add(url.rstrip("/") + href)
    return list(links)

def clean_html(html):
    # Remove extra whitespace
    html = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', html)
    return html

def save_website_as_pdf(url, output_pdf):
    options = Options()
    options.add_argument("--headless")
    driver = webdriver.Chrome(options=options)
    driver.get(url)
    html = driver.page_source
    driver.quit()
    cleaned_html = clean_html(html)
    path_wkhtmltopdf = '/usr/local/bin/wkhtmltopdf'  # Update if your path is different
    config = pdfkit.configuration(wkhtmltopdf=path_wkhtmltopdf)
    pdfkit.from_string(cleaned_html, output_pdf, configuration=config)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    website_url = 'https://sldaveducation.org/' #input("Enter website URL: ")

    print("Scanning website for links...")
    links = get_all_links(website_url)
    print(f"Found {len(links)} links. Saving main page as PDF...")
    save_website_as_pdf(website_url, output_pdf)
    print(f"PDF saved as {output_pdf}")

```python
"""
web_crawler_to_pdf.py

Requirements:
    pip install selenium beautifulsoup4 fpdf requests

You must have compatible chromedriver for your Chrome in your PATH.
Edit 'base_url' and 'max_pages' below as needed.

Example usage:
    python web_crawler_to_pdf.py
"""

import time
import re
import sys
from urllib.parse import urljoin, urlparse

from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.chrome.options import Options
from selenium.common.exceptions import TimeoutException, WebDriverException
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC

from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
from fpdf import FPDF

# ------------------- CONFIGURATION -------------------

base_url = "https://sldaveducation.org/"   # <-- CHANGE THIS TO YOUR TARGET SITE
max_pages = 1                    # Max pages to crawl, change as needed

# ------------- SELENIUM INIT (CHROME) -------------

chrome_options = Options()
chrome_options.add_argument("--headless")
chrome_options.add_argument('--disable-gpu')
chrome_options.add_argument('--no-sandbox')
chrome_options.add_argument('--incognito')

try:
    driver = webdriver.Chrome(options=chrome_options)
except WebDriverException:
    print('Error: Chrome WebDriver is not installed/in PATH or incompatible version. See selenium docs.')
    sys.exit(1)

# ------------------- UTILS -------------------

def is_internal(link, base_netloc):
    # Test that link is internal (same netloc, ignore http/https difference)
    try:
        parsed = urlparse(urljoin(base_url, link))
        return parsed.netloc == base_netloc
    except Exception:
        return False

def clean_text(text):
    # Remove leading/trailing, collapse multiple spaces, remove blank lines
    lines = [re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', l.strip()) for l in text.splitlines()]
    no_blanks = [l for l in lines if l]
    return '\n'.join(no_blanks)

def extract_main_content(html):
    # Try to extract body/main/article, skip nav/footer/aside etc.
    soup = BeautifulSoup(html, 'html.parser')
    for tag in soup(['nav', 'footer', 'aside', 'script', 'style', 'header', 'form', 'noscript']):
        for t in soup.find_all(tag):
            t.decompose()
    main = soup.find('main')
    if main:
        text = main.get_text(separator='\n', strip=True)
    else:
        article = soup.find('article')
        if article:
            text = article.get_text(separator='\n', strip=True)
        else:
            body = soup.find('body')
            text = body.get_text(separator='\n', strip=True) if body else soup.get_text(separator='\n', strip=True)
    return clean_text(text)

def url_to_filename(url):
    netloc = urlparse(url).netloc
    return netloc.replace(':', '_') + "_website.pdf"

# ------------------- MAIN CRAWL LOGIC -------------------

visited = set()
queue = [base_url]
collected = []
base_netloc = urlparse(base_url).netloc
pages_crawled = 0

print(f"Starting crawl on: {base_url}")
print(f"Maximum pages to crawl: {max_pages}")

while queue and pages_crawled < max_pages:
    url = queue.pop(0)
    if url in visited:
        continue
    try:
        driver.get(url)
        WebDriverWait(driver, 10).until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.TAG_NAME, 'body')))
        html = driver.page_source
        content = extract_main_content(html)
        if content and len(content) > 40:
            collected.append({'url': url, 'content': content})
            pages_crawled += 1
            print(f"[{pages_crawled}/{max_pages}] Crawled: {url} ({len(content)} chars)")
        else:
            print(f"Skipped (empty or trivial): {url}")

        soup = BeautifulSoup(html, 'html.parser')
        for a in soup.find_all('a', href=True):
            link = urljoin(url, a['href'].split('#')[0])
            if (is_internal(link, base_netloc) and
                link not in visited and
                link not in queue and
                not re.search(r'\.(jpg|jpeg|png|gif|pdf|doc|zip|tar|mp4|mp3|svg)$', link, re.I)):
                queue.append(link)
    except TimeoutException:
        print(f"Timeout loading: {url}")
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error ({type(e).__name__}) scraping {url}: {e}")
    visited.add(url)

driver.quit()

if not collected:
    print("No pages collected. Exiting.")
    sys.exit(0)

# ------------------- PDF GENERATION -------------------

filename = url_to_filename(base_url)
from fpdf import FPDF
pdf = FPDF()
pdf.add_page()
pdf.add_font("DejaVu", "", "DejaVuSans.ttf", uni=True)   # <- Needs DejaVuSans.ttf in your script folder!
pdf.set_font("DejaVu", size=12)

pdf.set_font("DejaVu", size=12)

for idx, page in enumerate(collected):
    pdf.add_page()
    title = f"Page {idx+1}: {page['url']}"
    pdf.set_font("DejaVu", style="", size=12)
    pdf.multi_cell(0, 10, title)
    pdf.set_font("DejaVu", size=12)
    pdf.ln(4)
    pdf.multi_cell(0, 8, page['content'])

try:
    pdf.output(filename)
    print(f"Collected {len(collected)} pages. PDF saved as: {filename}")
except Exception as e:
    print(f"Error saving PDF: {e}")
```

title: Add Getting Started welcome content for empty chat sessions view
body:
When the chat sessions view has no coding agent runs, it appears completely empty and mysterious to users, making it unclear what the view is for or how to get started.

![Empty chat sessions view](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c6086b63-bbe8-4504-a413-a46d14f32184)

This PR adds welcome content that appears when the view is empty, following VS Code's standard pattern for empty views.

## Changes

**Added welcome content registration:**
- Created `ChatSessionsWelcomeContribution` that registers welcome content for the local chat sessions view
- Uses VS Code's standard `IViewsRegistry.registerViewWelcomeContent()` system
- Provides clear explanation of what the view is for and actionable next steps

**Made SessionsViewPane implement IViewWelcomeDelegate:**
- Added `shouldShowWelcome()` method that returns `true` when no session items exist
- Added `onDidChangeViewWelcomeState` event to notify when empty state changes
- Integrated state tracking with existing data loading and refresh mechanisms

**Welcome message content:**
```
No coding agent runs yet.

Start your first coding session to see your agent's work history here.

[New Chat](command:workbench.action.chat.open)
[Start Agent Mode](command:workbench.action.chat.newEditSession)
```

The welcome content automatically appears when there are no chat sessions and disappears when sessions are created, providing users with clear guidance on how to get started with coding agents.

Fixes #258537.

title: [Suggestion - Github Copilot Chat] "Chat: Import Chat..." command setting for chat placement after import.
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Currently, the "Import Chat" command will always place the imported chat as an editor tab within your current workspace. This suggestion is to add a setting to dictate where imported chats should be placed, between the workspace, the sidebar/chat panel, or not at all (and simply adding it to the chat history rather than visually bringing it to the forefront of your screen). This is mainly due to the annoyance of importing multiple chats and having to exit out of each chat conversation tab.

title: [Suggestion - Github Copilot Chat] Bulk Imports for the "Chat: Import Chat..." command.

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

milestone.title: Backlog Candidates
milestone.description: Work that is not yet accepted for the Backlog. We wait for the community to weigh in.

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Related Issue: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/257856 (bug preventing access to old chat histories, which gets fixed by doing chat imports).

Currently, the "Import Chat" command restricts you to importing a single .json file at a time. This suggestion is to add the ability to import multiple .json files at once, with each file being a separate chat conversation, as to minimize hassle of bulk imports.

This would be an extremely beneficial addition for the purpose of chat backups from a workspaceStorage session, or if a user wants to port over conversations from one workspace into another.

This would also help immensely for instances where a workspaceStorage session becomes inaccessible due to workspace renaming, modifications, saving, etc., losing access to that session's chat histories.

body:
Type: Performance Issue - Enable the `terminal.integrated.suggest` and use PowerShell. - Trigger the IntelliSense. - Try selecting an option (by Enter). - See the lag huge lag in terminal while it's writing down the selected option. I believe this is due to inefficient trigger of `Get-Command`. I suspect the command is taking long to finish. For example, it might be my custom profile that is slow for frequent trigger of it. Passing `-NoProfile` might help. title: Want "Open with Code" on Windows 11's new context menu

labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
I'd like **Open with Code** added to Windows 11's new context menu, which makes it easier than right-clicking the desktop or folder and clicking **Show more options**. Right-clicking the desktop and clicking **Open with Code** on Windows 11's new context menus opens a stable version of Visual Studio Code.

title: Chat shows success for run_in_terminal tool calls that exit with code 1
body: Testing #258331 But tool log is: ```markdown tool : run_in_terminal args : { "command": "npx create-next-app@latest . --typescript --tailwind --eslint --app --src-dir --use-npm", "explanation": "Creating Next.js 14 project with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS", "isBackground": false } Response The directory sample10 contains files that could conflict: .github/ Either try using a new directory name, or remove the files listed above. Command exited with code 1 Thinking ``` Repro: 1. Open VS Code with Copilot Chat 2. In chat, ask: "Run the command ls /nonexistent-directory" 3. Observe that Copilot uses the run_in_terminal tool 4. Note that the command fails with exit code 1 (directory doesn't exist) 5. Expected: Chat should indicate the command failed 6. Actual: Chat shows the tool call as successful with a green checkmark Should the checkmark show tool execution success or actual command success?

title: Chat fails to render old terminal commands

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: candidate
labels.description: Issue identified as probable candidate for fixing in the next release

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body: - Open an old chat session with a terminal command in it from history - See this error about rendering the content Remember that chat content is persisted across versions and we need to either be backwards compatible or migrate data forward. I'm actually curious what you think about this because it's not an easy problem and I've done it in a sort of ad-hoc way so far. I sort of have a pattern for this but it may not be fully fleshed out enough for you https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/5b7867967324732ae16387f3d403deb822dfa10b/src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/common/chatModel.ts#L1032 Probably what's missing is that `ISerializableChatRequestData` is not versioned like `ISerializableChatData` is. You can probably find an easy fix and maybe I can help build a better system for handling this going forward.

title: Chat doesn't indicate when terminal commands are waiting for user input
body: Testing #258331 The terminal command run by Copilot is wating on user input but there is no indication of this in chat when the cmd is invoked by Copilot. I jonly see a spinner next to the command in chat. Previously, the terminal windows would auto open and show execution. I had to manually open the terminal to see that it was waiting on user input. Repo steps: Invoke `#new` to scaffold a new project which requires running a cli to scaffold a project.
